top_categories.workout_context: Oregon Coast Gravel Epic’s coastal gravel, coast range demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Oregon Coast Gravel Epic rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Racing Oregon Coast Gravel Epic isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Oregon Coast Gravel Epic when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Oregon Coast Gravel Epic. Make this intensity feel like home.
Oregon Coast Gravel Epic’s coastal and coast range gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Oregon Coast Gravel Epic’s 5,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Oregon Coast Gravel Epic — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Oregon Coast Gravel Epic’s coastal and coast range gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Oregon Coast Gravel Epic’s 5,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Oregon Coast Gravel Epic — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on coastal and coast range gravel.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Oregon Coast Gravel Epic — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Oregon Coast Gravel Epic’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Oregon Coast Gravel Epic. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Oregon Coast Gravel Epic requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on coastal and coast range gravel to build confidence. Expect: coastal gravel, coast range, forest roads.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, TT Threshold, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 62 miles of coastal and coast range gravel in Waldport, Oregon.
